subject: build: Add meson build
commitMessage:
build: Add meson build

Changes to note,
- `with_systemdsystemunitdir` and `with_tmpfilesdir` is removed since it
  is not being documented nor used in OpenBMC.
- Removed the Code coverage feature with `-DDHAVE_GCOV`, since it is not
  used and meson covers it.
- Removed `--enable-oe-sdk` for using the OpenBMC SDK. It should work
  directly with no change required.

Tested:
```
Jan 01 00:01:54 ipmid[709]: Try loading blob from persistent data
Jan 01 00:01:54 ipmid[709]: Stale blob data, resetting internals...
Jan 01 00:01:56 ipmid[709]: config loaded: /flash/bios
Jan 01 00:01:56 ipmid[709]: config loaded: /flash/image
Jan 01 00:01:56 ipmid[709]: config loaded: /flash/dummy
...
```

```
$ ls /usr/lib/blob-ipmid/
libfirmwareblob.so
libfirmwarecleanupblob.so  libversionblob.so
```

Testing the service,
```
$ echo "hello" > /tmp/test.txt
$ burn_my_bmc -command update -layout dummy -image /tmp/test.txt
Sending over the firmware image.
Opening the verification file
Committing to /flash/verify to trigger service
Calling stat on /flash/verify session to check status
running
success
Returned success
succeeded
```

On the BMC.
```
/run/initramfs$ cat dummy
hello
```

Change-Id: I21c7c33bd62c0ee40681cb40da90125c125bea2f
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as bcae90026be5d1cdb6aa97f8fa01c025c34920d8 by Willy Tu

```
Executing subproject phosphor-ipmi-blobs 

phosphor-ipmi-blobs| Project name: phosphor-ipmi-blobs
phosphor-ipmi-blobs| Project version: 0.1
phosphor-ipmi-blobs| C++ compiler for the host machine: c++ (gcc 11.1.0 "c++ (Ubuntu 11.1.0-1ubuntu1~21.04) 11.1.0")
phosphor-ipmi-blobs| C++ linker for the host machine: c++ ld.bfd 2.36.1
phosphor-ipmi-blobs| Dependency phosphor-logging found: YES 1.0.0 (cached)
phosphor-ipmi-blobs| WARNING: Project targeting '>=0.51.0' but tried to use feature introduced in '0.53.0': Fallback without variable name.
phosphor-ipmi-blobs| Run-time dependency ipmiblob found: NO (tried pkgconfig and cmake)

subprojects/phosphor-ipmi-blobs/meson.build:26:0: ERROR: Dependency "ipmiblob" not found, tried pkgconfig and cmake
```

Is there something that I have to to fix this?

I am able to run the Docker CI locally with no issue.

This happens only when it depends on the subproject.

------

there is also another issue if de meet the `phosphor-ipmi-blob` dependency. 

```
firmware_close_unittest.cpp.o -c ../bmc/firmware-handler/test/firmware_close_unittest.cpp
In file included from ../bmc/firmware-handler/test/firmware_close_unittest.cpp:2:
../bmc/firmware-handler/firmware_handler.hpp:3:10: fatal error: config.h: No such file or directory
    3 | #include "config.h"
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~
```

It will not find `config.h` if it does not build the subproject. Is this expected? 

This will project break once we move the recipe build to meson.

It can be fixed this by not building the phosphor-ipmi-blobs as subproject. CI can automatically build this library if seeing such dependency. phosphor-ipmi-blobs subproject building fails probably because it has dependency on ipmiblob and ipmid that are not build by either meson  or CMake and phosphor-ipmi-blobs source code does not process ipmiblob and ipmid as subprojects.

thanks. I'll try it out.


---
Just a note on the `config.h`

And for the config.h stuff, it is not resolved. I needed to create config.h for this project.

nice it worked. Thanks.

I was struggling to understand why it couldn't work. 🙏

That is probably the answer for `why`. It can be fixed if we create ipmid and ipmibob subprojects in phoshor-ipmi-blobs in phosphor-ipmi-blobs.

But now this change LGTM.

This run into warning error with alignof.

```
../tools/helper.cpp: In function 'void* host_tool::memcpyAligned(void*, const void*, std::size_t)':
../tools/helper.cpp:181:5: error: ISO C++ does not allow 'alignof' with a non-type [-Werror=pedantic]
  181 |     alignof(destination);
      |     ^~~~~~~
../tools/helper.cpp:181:5: error: statement has no effect [-Werror=unused-value]
  181 |     alignof(destination);
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

I am not sure how we can fix this.
Done

I am looking at this and is confused on when this will ever fail.

Isn't getting `alignof(destination)` the same as alignof(viod*). That will be the same as any pointer.

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/alignof

Does the pointer get different valid of alignof depending on the system?

Vivek? do you have the reasoning behind it? https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-ipmi-flash/+/40727

Some basic test,

```
struct alignas(alignof(std::uint16_t)) test
{
} __attribute__((packed));


std::cout << "uint16_t : " << alignof(std::uint16_t) << std::endl;
std::cout << "test : " << alignof(test) << std::endl;
std::cout << "test* : " << sizeof(test *) << std::endl;
std::cout << "void* : " << alignof(void *) << std::endl;
```

Output
```
uint16_t : 2
test : 2
test* : 8
void* : 8
```

----

So I am wondering if we even need the check at all.
I misunderstood the alignof().  My intention was to check if the destination and source address es are 8 byte aligned.
Initially I had a basic alignment check  "(destination & (sizeof(uint64_t) - 1) == 0)" but saw this function used in some other place and thought it might be better to use that.
Done

nit.
The cmake_options kwarg for the subproject function is now deprecated since it is replaced by the new options system since meson 0.55
Done. Thanks

cmake = import('cmake')
 opt_var = import('cmake).cmake.subproject_options()
 opt_var.append_compile_args('c++', ['-DCMAKE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE=ON', '-DMASTER_PROJECT=OFF']
fmt_proj = cmake.subproject('fmt', options: opt_var)
fmt_dep = fmt_proj.dependency('fmt')

I was suggesting something like this.

Good news CI passed!
Thanks. I have updated now.

Does the build actually end up broken if you enable everything? Some day we might enable test building during image building so I don't think this has much value if it allows these when tests are built.

yeah, enabling everything will have duplicate definition of the handlers.

Like `nuvoton-p2a-vga` and `nuvoton-p2a-mbox` create the definition of the same functions.

Maybe we can just have a new flag, maybe like `obmc-test`? then with that just enable the tests, but not includes all the default test files.
Ack
Features should generally be auto by default, which is the implicit default value.

Done.

I have move all the enabled features as auto
Generally if auto detection doesn't apply it should be a boolean not feature, the same is true in many other places.
Done. I have move all the options except the build options as boolean.
If static and ubi are exclusive options, you should make it a single option of type `combo`. I didn't notice any others yet but it would generally be good to use in these type of cases.
I think all the lpc and pci stuff can also be combo?
Done
Can all of these be built by default just to make sure they do compile?

The tests enabled the enabled the following

- lpc_aspeed
- lpc_nuvoton
- pci_handler (aspeed)

Enabling the Nuvoton p2a will fail to build.
this is fine, right?
Yeah, I guess it would be nice to clean things up so we could test all of them in a single build. I think the way it's designed right now its not possible to do this.
Do any of these really need to be options? If no one is using them I would be inclined to remove them.

yeah, I am not sure exactly. It was in the README.md, so I added back in just in case.

I doubt anyone is using it.

Do we want to remove all of the these options?

I checked OpenBMC and I don't think people are overriding it. Doesn't look like there are bbpand for ipmi-flash.

Only MAPPED_ADDRESS is actually used right now.
You can make a separate change to get rid of them. I don't think there is any reason to expose them.
nit: nor?
Done
I think you may have missed a word here
Done
nit: work?
Done

Trying to test this on a real system with https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/46981

Ran into issue installing the shared library.


```
NOTE: Executing Tasks
ERROR: phosphor-ipmi-flash-1.0+gitAUTOINC+bfbbb75ea9-r1 do_package: QA Issue: phosphor-ipmi-flash: Files/directories were installed but not shipped in any package:
  /usr/lib/ipmid-providers/libversionblob.so
  /usr/lib/ipmid-providers/libfirmwarecleanupblob.so
  /usr/lib/ipmid-providers/libfirmwareblob.so
Please set FILES such that these items are packaged. Alternatively if they are unneeded, avoid installing them or delete them within do_install.
phosphor-ipmi-flash: 3 installed and not shipped files. [installed-vs-shipped]
ERROR: phosphor-ipmi-flash-1.0+gitAUTOINC+bfbbb75ea9-r1 do_package: Fatal QA errors found, failing task.

```

I am not sure what I am missing here.

I also tried to add do_install() to install it with no luck.
FILES_${PN}:append = " /usr/lib/ipmid-providers" looks like you need add all *so files there

Doing,

```
FILES:${PN}:append = " ${libdir}/ipmid-providers"
FILES:${PN}:append = " ${libdir}/tmpfiles.d"
```

seems to work again. Maybe I missed something when that was failing.

Thanks for the pointer.

----

It seems like it is broken. I'll test to test it out work. It builds but fail to run. No blob shows up.

It will build libfirmwareblob.so  libfirmwarecleanupblob.so  libversionblob.so if you fix the typo I pointed out below.

please Add tested in the commit message. Testing should cover building with bitbake and in-band image flash functionality using any host tools.

I did test with that fix. I guess I forgot to push it.

I am still testing it out and will update the commit message with the result once I am able to fix it.

For right now, it has the libraries, but
```
$ ls /usr/lib/ipmid-providers/ | grep blob
libblobmanager.so
libfirmwareblob.so
libfirmwarecleanupblob.so
libversionblob.so
```

but seems to failed to run. I'll have to debug it more. But yeah, I just have this review to get some help on it for now. Not planning to submit it until I have everything working.

I see. Probably libfirmwareblob.so
libfirmwarecleanupblob.so
libversionblob.so should be installed under /usr/lib/blob-ipmid

You can double check with William or Brandon.

Ah, yes. You are right.

I read https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-phosphor/classes/obmc-phosphor-ipmiprovider-symlink.bbclass wrong.

I thought it we install all to `ipmid-providers` and it install to each separate folder. Seems like it is the other way.

Thanks. It is working now. I'll test it out some more and should be good for now. + some other more clean ups.
typo?
Done
remove this in change 46817

oh, oops. This should still be in as part of this change.

I accidentally deleted it while I was testing it.

I have reverted it now.
as we do not use it?
Done
nit: work with
Done
I usually see this in the test meson.build but I guess since we have multiple in different directories, it makes sense to declare this at the root directory.
unused? AFAIK none of these files include `config.h`
Done
Tests shouldn't configure the option itself, so we shouldn't need to check this as part of the assert.

this is checking when we are not using tests.

So we want one of the `lpc-type` or `p2a-type` to be none when we are not testing.
I think this goes with the question about allowing both to be configure, I don't see a problem with that as it's technically possible to support both on a single machine while migrating between them.
Ack
Is this actually broken? I guess we don't use it and could fix it if we ever cared.
It is not broken. you could enable both lpc and p2a, but I don't know if we want to allow that for non test builds.
Right, but a server could technically enable both even though we don't in practice.
We could do this in a follow up, like the follow up removing a bunch of the config options.
This assert can go away now?
yeah, this shouldn't be possible with combo now.
Did the old autotools code allow us to build without the BMC bits being enabled?

I don't think so. `phosphor-ipmi-blob` was also required in the autotools

How do you check if the BMC bits is not enabled.?
I think you can move some of these dependencies down into the BMC subdir so that someone disabling the BMC build would not depend on them.
Done
You should recurse into these subdirs from bmc/meson.build
Done

It should always be enabled in our test environment, so we shouldn't need this extra check. In general I'd like unrelated build options to not change because tests are enabled. Obviously the way the mailbox handlers are done right now that isn't 100% possible.
right, since it should be auto.

We should open an issue against anyone using the provided json files and have them provide their own. There is way more build infrastructure to populate a single / 2 json files than there would be to just have users drop in their own configs as needed.

wait, what do we need to do here? This is for like the `config-bmc.json` and such, right?

Do we want to remove those to force the people to use their own?
Yeah, almost all of the users of these files end up providing their own replacements for services like verification anyway. So we don't really need to provide these via meson.
Ack
Why is this one separate?
I guess it was because it guess have the `tools_` prefix. I'll change it.
I don't think you need the extra JSON files with tests?

yep, seems like it.

It was included before, and I guess that was wrong. I have removed it now.
